segments.text: She said what?
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: She said, "If I'm not gonna be happy getting married somewhere that we find in a day, well then we should just postpone it."
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: Postpone it?
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Emily, do you think Monica realises how much our parents spent on this wedding?
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Do you my sister's teeny-tiny little brain comprehends that people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here, huh?
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: This isn't right.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I realize that people are going to be disappointed. But, I'm sure they'll come back when we can do it right.
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: I can't ask people to do that? Would you ask people to do that?
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Don't you point your pants at me!
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: We have no choice!
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: Anywhere that's half-decent would've be booked months ago, Ross don't you understand?
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: This is our wedding I'm talking about.
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: The only thing I understand is postponing it is not an option. This is when we're getting married.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: So what are you saying? It's now or never?
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: No. I'm saying it's now.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Or?
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: There's no 'or' in mind. What is wrong with these pants?!!
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: It's not the pants.
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: It's you that is backwards.
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: And if, and if you don't understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we shouldn't get married at all!
segments.speaker: Emily

segments.text: No, wait! Emily! No, wait, stop! Emily, pleaseâ€”
segments.speaker: Ross
